description: Manage a web app's Azure storage account configurations. (Linux Web Apps and Windows Containers Web Apps Only).

commands.name: az webapp config storage-account add
commands.summary: Add an Azure storage account configuration to a web app. (Linux Web Apps and Windows Containers Web Apps Only).
commands.syntax:
az webapp config storage-account add --access-key
                                     --account-name
                                     --custom-id
                                     --share-name
                                     --storage-type {AzureBlob, AzureFiles}
                                     [--ids]
                                     [--mount-path]
                                     [--name]
                                     [--resource-group]
                                     [--slot]
                                     [--slot-setting]
                                     [--subscription]
examples:
az webapp config storage-account add -g MyResourceGroup -n MyUniqueApp \
  --custom-id CustomId \
  --storage-type AzureFiles \
  --account-name MyStorageAccount \
  --share-name MyShare \
  --access-key MyAccessKey \
  --mount-path /path/to/mount

commands.name: az webapp config storage-account delete
commands.summary: Delete a web app's Azure storage account configuration. (Linux Web Apps and Windows Containers Web Apps Only).
examples: az webapp config storage-account delete --custom-id CustomId --name MyWebApp --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az webapp config storage-account list
commands.summary: Get a web app's Azure storage account configurations. (Linux Web Apps and Windows Containers Web Apps Only).
examples: az webapp config storage-account list --name MyWebApp --resource-group MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az webapp config storage-account update
commands.summary: Update an existing Azure storage account configuration on a web app. (Linux Web Apps and Windows Containers Web Apps Only).
commands.syntax:
az webapp config storage-account update --custom-id
                                        [--access-key]
                                        [--account-name]
                                        [--ids]
                                        [--mount-path]
                                        [--name]
                                        [--resource-group]
                                        [--share-name]
                                        [--slot]
                                        [--slot-setting]
                                        [--storage-type {AzureBlob, AzureFiles}]
                                        [--subscription]
examples:
az webapp config storage-account update -g MyResourceGroup -n MyUniqueApp \
  --custom-id CustomId \
  --mount-path /path/to/new/mount

az webapp config storage-account update --access-key MyAccessKey --account-name MyAccount --custom-id CustomId --mount-path /path/to/new/mount --name MyUniqueApp --resource-group MyResourceGroup --share-name MyShare --storage-type AzureFiles
